message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.DB, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the technical challenge of anti-money laundering (AML) and proposes the use of scalable graph convolutional neural networks for forensic analysis of financial data. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.DB (Databases), and cs.CY (Computers and Society). However, given the focus on AML and financial data analysis, cs.CR and cs.SI are the most likely categories. The use of graph deep learning also suggests a potential overlap with cs.LG, while the emphasis on data analysis and management could relate to cs.DB. Finally, the broader societal implications of organized crime and money laundering could connect to cs.CY.
